result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridgette L. Yakovich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber privileges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.
Concurrent with: Stayed sentence on Ct 3 in this same case

Defendant was ordered to report to the probation and parole office today if time, if not she needs to call the probation and parole office by 10:00 am on 9/18/2015.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to undergo a psychological evaluation and follow all recommendations, releasing all records to her agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with Derek Nixdorf or Ashley Miller  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant is not to possess or take any medications unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted 56 days credit for time served.  Jail sentence is on Ct 2 only.
